meanings.sent1: The whale beached itself during the storm.
meanings.sent2: The ship beached on the sandy shore.
meanings.sent3: The seagull beached itself on purpose to catch some sun.
meanings.sent4: The memories of childhood beached on the shores of my mind.
meanings.sent5: The colorful shells beached along the coast sparkled in the sunlight.

meanings.sent1: The beached boat awaited rescue by the coast guard.
meanings.sent2: The beached crab scuttled sideways in the sand.
meanings.sent3: The beached tourists built a sandcastle while waiting for help.
meanings.sent4: The beached surfboard lay forgotten by the water's edge.
meanings.sent5: The beached starfish dried out under the hot sun.

meanings.definition: To run or drive (a boat) aground on a beach.
meanings.sent1: The captain accidentally beached the ship on the hidden sandbar.
meanings.sent2: The fishermen beached their boat to unload the day's catch.
meanings.sent3: The pirates beached their vessel to bury their treasure on the island.
meanings.sent4: The storm forced the sailors to beach their boat to avoid sinking.
meanings.sent5: The explorers beached their canoe and set up camp for the night.
